payload.name: Essential Athens Highlights Full-Day Private Tour
payload.description: From pick up at your Cruise ship, Hotel, or Athens residence sit back in the comfort of one of our new Luxury Class Mercedes Vehicles as your experienced informative professional tour driver takes you on a private tour of all the Athens Highlights including the Acropolis, New Acropolis Museum, Arch of Hadrian, Temple of Zeus, Olympic Stadium, Parliament & Traditional National Guards, and National Archaeological Museum, so you won't miss anything during your visit. Our Flexible Booking Options allow you to include a wonderful Traditional Lunch (Silver Option), Expert guiding with a Licensed Professional Guide who will be with you for 3 hours to cover the Acropolis and Acropolis Museum (Gold Option), or both Lunch plus Guide (Platinum Option), whilst a Family & discount option is also available, as well as a Half-Day option including an expert guide for those preferring a shorter tour. Please note that for bookings of 8 or more persons, a private guide is automatically included.

payload.name: Private Tour of Delphi & Arachova from Athens
payload.description: Visit the breathtaking sites in Delphi and learn the rich history of Castalia Spring, the archaeological site and the Theatre, the Athenian Treasury, the Temple of Apollo famous for its oracle Pythia, the Navel of the Earth.Explore the Museum of Delphi, with its spectacular collection of artifacts, including the Naxian Sphinx, the unique bronze Charioteer and the Statue of Antinoos. Enjoy your traditional “village style” lunch on the magnificent Caldera at Delphi, overlooking fabulous Itea.

payload.name: Ancient Olympia Private Tour from Athens
payload.description: Discover the historic grounds where the Olympic Games were first conceived. Experience the thrill of sprinting down the very track ancient athletes once raced upon, where their sole reward was an olive wreath. Embrace the profound ambiance of the sacred site where the Olympic flame is ignited, connecting you directly to the essence of this timeless tradition.

payload.name: 2 Days Private Tour: Delphi & Meteora
payload.description: Experience the essence of Greece in just two days with a visit to two of its most renowned destinations. Explore the ancient wonders of Delphi, known as the center of the earth in Greek mythology, and be captivated by the awe-inspiring Meteora rocks, marveling at the breathtaking beauty of Greek nature.

payload.name: Best of Athens Half Day Private Tour
payload.description: During this amazing half day tour you will see all the most popular sights and experience the best parts of the city. But I will also show you the special things that make Athens great. On our way to the city, I will give you a lot of information about Athens history, mythology and culture. This tour is very flexible...! I can adjust the schedule, duration and activities to meet your needs. Please let me know of any special requests you have.

payload.name: Half Day Athens Sightseeing Tour with Acropolis Museum
payload.description: This tour gives you an opportunity to observe the striking contrasts that make Athens such a fascinating city. Our expert guides will take you to see the Panathenaic Stadium where the first Olympic Games of modern times were held in 1896 (short stop). Continue and pass by the Prime Minister's residence (ex Royal Palace) guarded by the Euzones in their colorful uniform, the Temple of Olympian Zeus, the Hadrian's Arch, the Parliament and the memorial to the Unknown Soldier, the Academy, the University, the National Library, the Constitution Square (Syntagma). On the Acropolis visit the Architectural Masterpieces of the Golden Age of Athens: The Propylaea, the Temple of Athena Nike, the Erechtheion and finally "the harmony between material and spirit", the monument that "puts order in the mind", the Parthenon. Continue and visit the place where at last the statues found their home and admire the wonders of the classical era: The new Acropolis museum.

payload.name: Seven Days Tour of Greece from Athens
payload.description: Greece through the centuries will unfold before you on this Seven Days Tour of Greece from Athens.Travel back in time to Ancient Greece with excursions to Mycenae, Olympia, Delphi, and more. With hotels, transportation, and most meals taken care of, this 7-day tour is perfect for adventurous history-buffs.The in-depth itinerary takes you to multiple renowned archaeological sites and their respective museums, which are overflowing with artifacts. Along the way, enjoy authentic Greek culture and cuisine.

payload.name: Best of Athens in a Fast Tour
payload.description: During this amazing fast tour you will see all the most popular sights and experiences, the best parts of the city. But I will also show you the special things that make Athens great. On our way to the city, I will give you a lot of information about Athens history, mythology and culture. I can adjust the schedule, duration and activities to meet your needs. Please let me know of any special requests you have. The uniqueness of this tour, combines something different from the other tours. It is being operated by a vehicle and you can only take photos inside of it. But, in consultation with the head office, we can make some stops for you to have a better view of the monuments we are going to visit. *This tour is very flexible...Our starting times go according to your needs...!!* **Let us know of any special request you have...!!**

payload.name: Epidaurus, Mycenae, Olympia and Delphi Three Days Tour from Athens
payload.description: Led by a professional and passionate guide, visit Greece's most important UNESCO-heritage sites such as the mythical site of Olympia, the Temple of Apollo in Delphi famous for its oracle and Mycenae, home to the kingdom of King Agamemnon. Prehistory, the Classical period, Roman domination, the Byzantine Empire, the Crusades and Modern times: Greece through the centuries will unfold before you on this three days tour.

payload.name: Traditional Greek Show With Dinner
payload.description: Embark on a memorable evening filled with vibrant sights, sounds, and flavors. Your adventure begins with a comfortable pick-up from your hotel or a nearby accessible location (if your hotel is not directly reachable).Enjoy a scenic, panoramic drive through the heart of Athens, offering you a chance to capture stunning photos of the iconic Acropolis, beautifully illuminated as the night falls.As we make our way through the charming, cobbled streets of Plaka – Athens’ enchanting old town – you’ll be immersed in the city's rich history and timeless beauty. We will then arrive at a welcoming traditional Greek taverna, where you’ll indulge in a delicious dinner, savoring the best of Greek cuisine.The evening truly comes alive with a captivating live music performance, where talented dancers in colorful, traditional costumes bring Greek folk dances to life, creating an unforgettable atmosphere of celebration and culture.

payload.name: Day tour to Ancient Olympia,Ancient Sparta Mycenae Including Meal
payload.description: **Our trip starts from Athens** Join me and let's visit the most majestic archaeological sites of Greece from Athens You will see all this monuments in A day when other operators need at least 2-3 days Value for Money full day tour in Peloponnese Our tour Starts early in The morning and we will return late in the night.!! On this amazing full day tour you will see the most beautiful sights and scenery. On our way I will give you a lot of information about history, mythology and culture. We will have the opportunity to visit some of the most majestic archaeological sites of Greece, such as Ancient Olympia, cave of Kaiadas, Ancient Sparta, Corinth Canal and Mycenae. I can adjust the schedule, duration and activities to meet your needs. You are welcome to inform us on any special requests you have. Do not waste your time in multi day tours - bus tours Book your private tour Now..!! Private - Luxury- Fast- Value for Money ONE DAY tour in Peloponnese.!!

payload.name: 3 Days Private Tour: Delphi & Meteora
payload.description: Embark on a journey of enchantment with this remarkable tour, offering you the chance to explore the legendary ancient Greek oracle of Delphi, renowned as the navel of the earth. Immerse yourself in the breathtaking natural and religious splendor of Meteora, and discover the hidden gems scattered throughout the picturesque Greek countryside, each revealing a piece of the country's rich tapestry of history and culture.

payload.name: Full Day Tour to Meteora and Vergina From Athens Including Dinner
payload.description: **Our trip starts from Athens** Let me take you to Ancient Macedonia and the Royal tombs of Aigai-Vergina! In this amazing full day tour you will see the most beautiful sights and scenery. On our way I will give you a lot of information about history, mythology and culture. First, we are going to visit Meteora and their majestic monasteries. Afterwards, we are going to see the breathtaking royal tombs of Aigai, which are located in Vergina, Veroia. I can adjust the schedule, duration and activities to meet your needs. You are welcome to inform us on any special requests you have. -Mercedes E 200 class(sedan), that is 3 years old with a full insurance coverage. -Clean and Air-conditioned, with Wi-Fi (Free internet). -Up to 3-4 customers. What’s Included Guiding Services Private Transportation Bottled water Snacks **At every stop, if you want something extra to buy, the cost must be covered by the travelers.** ***In the End of our Tour a Great Souvenir Gift is included.!!***

payload.name: Ancient Messene Private Tour from Athens
payload.description: Embark on an enriching Full-day journey to Messene, where you'll experience a seamless blend of the Saronic Gulf's breathtaking vistas and the Peloponnese mainland's rugged beauty, alongside a visit to one of Greece's paramount archaeological wonders, Ancient Messene. This tour unveils a concealed gem, offering a deep dive into the historical richness that lies waiting to be discovered.

payload.name: 4-Days Arachova Volos and Pelion Private Tour from Athens
payload.description: This excursion presents an excellent chance for individuals who are passionate about Greece's historical heritage and its natural wonders. Participants will have the opportunity to explore key locations across the Greek mainland, including Delphi and Pelion, as well as the cosmopolitan village of Arachova.

payload.name: Ancient Sparta & Mystras Private Day Tour from Athens
payload.description: Embark on an incredible journey through Laconia, where the annals of Ancient Greek history meet the intriguing chapters of the Medieval Greek era. This tour invites you to explore Sparta, the realm of Leonidas, and to step into the Byzantine age as you wander amongst the towers, palaces, and churches of Mystras, offering a comprehensive dive into the region's rich past.

payload.name: 2 Days Private Tour: Mycenae - Epidaurus - Nafplio - Nemea & Ancient Corinth
payload.description: Embark on a captivating journey through time with our two-day exploration of Argolis, a region steeped in captivating history and mythology. Delve into the rich tapestry of ancient Greece as we visit iconic sites brimming with tales of gods, heroes, and legends, offering an immersive experience that will leave you enchanted and enlightened.

payload.name: 7 Days Private Tour: Argolida - Sparta - Monemvasia - Mani - Olympia & Delphi
payload.description: This tour gives our guests the intellectual pleasure of visiting numerous ancient and historical sites and the spiritual pleasure of being in this unique environment, the mountainous land, the sun and the sea for 7 days.

payload.name: Thermopylae, Meteora and Delphi Private Full Day Tour
payload.description: Our trip starts from Athens. On this amazing full day tour you will see the most beautiful sights and scenery. On our way I will give you a lot of information about history, mythology and culture. We will enjoy a visit to Delphi, novel of the world and the religious sites of Meteora. Also, we will pass by Thermopylae, where the 300 Spartans fought and the breathtaking Arachova. I can adjust the schedule, duration and activities to meet your needs. Please let me know of any special requests you have.

payload.name: Classical Tour of Greece with Nafplio - Four Days  from Athens
payload.description: Experience the glory of ancient Greece on this Classical Tour of Greece in 4 days departing from Athens.Visit important UNESCO World Heritage sites and overnight stays at Nafplio – the first capital of modern Greece, Olympia and Delphi.Led by a professional and passionate guide you will explore the reknowned theater of Epidaurus, Mycenae, home to the kingdom of King Agamemnon, the mythical site of Olympia and the Temple of Apollo in Delphi famous for its oracle. ItineraryDay 1After your pick up from your Athens central hotel, depart via the coastal National highway for the strategically Corinth Canal (short stop).Continue to Epidaurus and visit the Ancient theatre, world famous for its outstanding acoustics.Then proceed to Nafplio where we have the afternoon free.Dinner and overnight in Nafplio.Day 2In the morning after breakfast at the hotel, we visit the land of Homer’s Golden Mycenae, an UNESCO World Heritage site.Dating back to the second century B.C., Mycenae was one of the major centers of Greek civilization and a military stronghold which dominated much of southern Greece. You will see the Cyclopean Walls, the Lion’s Gate, the Royal Tombs, including Agamemnon & Clytemnestra’s, and the Treasury of Atreus, a magnificent 14th-century B.C. structure.Then depart in the afternoon for Olympia, the birth place of the Olympic Games, through Central Peloponnese and the towns of Tripolis and Megalopolis.Dinner and overnight in Olympia, the cradle of the Olympic Games.Day 3In the morning, after breakfast, we visit the Archaeological Site of Olympia with the Sanctuary of Olympian Zeus, the Ancient Stadium and the Archaeological Museum.We then drive on through the plains of Ilia and Achaia until the magnificent bridge which is crossing the Corinthian Bay from Rion to Antirion. Pass by the picturesque towns of Nafpactos (Lepanto) and Itea, and arrive in Delphi.Dinner and overnight in Delphi.Day 4On our last day, we visit the Archaeological Site and the Museum of Delphi.A couple of hours free time in Delphi before departing and drive through the village of Arachova, renowned for its colorful rugs and carpets. Return to Athens via Levadia and Thebes.Arrive in Athens early in the evening.

payload.name: One Day Cruise to Hydra - Poros - Aegina from Athens
payload.description: Discover this One Day Cruise from Athens to the Saronic. The daily cruise in three magical greek islands, Hydra, Poros and Aegina, isn’t just a trip but instead, is an experience you will never forget.A unique experience, a unique cruise, a special day. This cruise will introduce you to the Greek sun, sea and fun, traveling to three islands in one day. Come on board for a unique experience and create unforgettable memories.Get on board and experience the combination of Greek hospitality and multicultural co-existence. A big group of people of different nationalities, customs and cultures in addition to the unique Greek hospitality and entertainment, will travel like never before. They will dance and sing together across the deep blue Mediterranean waters, enjoying the sun, the tasty foods and delicacies.Ports of Calls The Cosmopolitan HYDRA, with its cobblestone alleys, its unspoilt –over the centuries- unique architectural beauty, as well as the traditional means of transportation that you can find on the island, its donkeys, will make the visitors fall in love with it at first sight. Enjoying a walk and discover the historic landmarks.The cinematic island POROS, with an insuperable natural beauty and thousands of pine trees, expanding from the steep and sandy beaches, making the romance and calmness island.The historical AEGINA, which took its name by the beautiful nymph that, was kidnapped by Zeus. Aegina is well known across the world for the delicious pistachios, the beautiful beaches, the Temple of Aphea and St. Nektarios Monastery.Additionally, our guests can book transportation, breakfast on board and shore excursions on the islands, with extra fees. The shore excursions are Hydra walking tour, swim escape to Agistri Island with traditional boat from Aegina and the experience of Afaia Ancient Temple and the Greek Orthodox Monastery of St. Nektarios on Aegina by bus.One Day, Three Islands, 1000 Memories A trip to the islands of pleasures

payload.name: Nafplio, Mycenae and Epidaurus Two Days Tour from Athens
payload.description: Take this Nauplio, Mycenae & Epidaurus Two Days Tour from Athens and get to know the best of Nafplio, the first capital of modern Greece combined with a visit at two UNESCO’S world heritage monuments Mycenae & Epidaurus Participants in this tour will have an afternoon and a morning free in order to see more of the picturesque town of Nauplion that the Venetians called “Naples of Greece”. Enjoy strolling around the picturesque old town, explore the Palamidi fortress or have a coffee beside the sea viewing the impressive Bourtzi islet.

payload.name: Athens By Afternoon Including a Dinner
payload.description: Make the most of your layover in Athens and discover its secrets and tips with a professional driver. Welcome to Athens. During this amazing half day tour you will see all the most popular sights and experience the best parts of the city. But I will also show you the special things that make Athens great. 4 points of Athenian history unfold in your eyes in just 5 hours. Starting with the unification of the city of Athens in 1300 BC, advancing to the Roman Empire in the years 300 BC to 270 AD, continuing to the Ottoman Empire and the mosques of the Monastiraki region and ending in the victory of the Allies in the second world war where the united states of America, led by Truman, helped the country financially. I can adjust the schedule, duration and activities to meet your needs. Please let me know of any special requests you have.

payload.name: Delphi and Meteora Three Days Tour from Athens
payload.description: Take this Delphi & Meteora Three Days Tour to enjoy a unique trip visiting two of Greece’s most impressive UNESCO World Heritage sites.The archeological site of Delphi with Apollo temple, also known as the ‘navel of the world’ and the stunning rock-tower monasteries of Meteora.Begin with pick up from Athens and board your luxury air conditioned bus with your professional guide.Visit the Delphi archeological site where the temple of Apollo was considered as ‘the navel of the wold’ in ancient Greece, a site that has played an extremely important role at the evolution and political situation of ancient Athens and the rest of Greece.We also visit the impressive Meteora. Meaning “suspended in air” the name Meteora soon came to encompass the entire rock community of monasteries, the biggest and most important group of monasteries in Greece after those in Mount Athos. The rock monasteries have been characterized by UNESCO as a unique phenomenon of cultural heritage.

payload.name: Cape Sounio & Temple of Poseidon Tour
payload.description: Drive along the coastal road, passing the wonderful beaches of Glyfada, Vouliagmeni & Varkiza to the most Southern point of Attica, Cape Sounion, where the white marble pillars of the Temple of Poseidon stand. On the way, you have a splendid view of the Saronic Gulf and the little islands offshore.As you approach Cape Sounion, one of Greece’s most photographed monuments, it rises like a sheer cliff out of the sea. At  Cape Sounio you will visit the 5th century B.C. Temple of Poseidon with one of the most breathtaking panoramic views in the world (on a clear day you can see at least seven islands).The beauty of the surviving Doric columns has inspired many poets, including Lord Byron who carved his name on one of the columns.  After visiting the Temple of Poseidon, you have time to walk at leisure on the rocky promontory of Sounion.

payload.name: Athens Beer Tasting Shared Experience
payload.description: • Learn about the first local microbrewery in Patra and centuries-old traditions. • Try a selection of Five different Greek craft beers and powerful Ales combined with local artisanal cold cuts, cheese and savory bites. • Gain a better perception and appreciation of the Greek brewing scene and open your mind and palate to a whole new world of beer. • Share the experience with other fun people and dive to a new beer culture • Personable, knowledgeable guide. • 5-star service & authentic Greek hospitality

payload.name: Thebes & Chalkida Island Private Tour from Athens
payload.description: Embark on a journey that seamlessly merges two enchanting destinations into one unforgettable experience. Discover the charming allure of Chalkida, just a short distance from Athens, where you'll immerse yourself in its idyllic daytrip atmosphere. Then, venture into the unhurried pace of life in Thebes, all while savoring the rich tapestry of Greek history that awaits at every turn.

payload.name: Athens by Night: Small Group Sightseeing with Drinks and Food Tasting
payload.description: Discover the best of Greek cuisine on a 4-hour small-group tour. The well-rounded evening itinerary presents traditional food in a modern atmosphere. Follow your guide through ancient Athens and into the hip Psirri neighborhood.

payload.name: Private Tour of Blue Lagoon, Sanctuary of Hera, Mycenae, Corinth & Isthmus Canal from Athens
payload.description: Be amazed by the modern engineering masterpiece of the Corinth Canal (Isthmus Canal). Explore the large citadel of Acrocorinth. Through its imposing entrance gates, you will enter the castle and you will discover its hidden gems. You will also experience the spectacular panoramic views which will amaze you. Witness the ancient town of Corinth, one of the richest towns in Ancient Greece, where St. Paul lived and preached for two years. We will visit the ruins of the ancient city in which you can see the remains of the Agora and one of the most outstanding monuments of pre –Roman period, the temple of Apollo. Be amazed by the kingdom of Agamemnon, Mycenae and relive the expedition to Troy.  Explore the Temple of Hera Akraia and St. Johns “tiny” church at Perachora.  Swim amongst the ancient ruins at Ancient Heraion. For the more adventurous, you will have a chance to do some “cliff-jumping” from the surrounding rocks, as the sea in the sanctuary cove is both deep and clear.  Discover the Malagavi Lighthouse, one of the oldest stone lighthouses in Greece built in 1897 that is still in operation.

payload.name: Athens Small Group or Private Hipsters' Walk
payload.description: Athenians who are behind this scene, and capturing the best spots of the city blowing up your Instagram account Duration 4 Hours Highlights Discover the hippest local spots in Athens, such as trendy coffee shops, artists’ workshops, and music studios Watch the city’s most innovative creators at work Explore the modern street food scene in Athens and taste some of the locals’ favorite gourmet snacks Meet young local artists and learn about the production of handmade objects in designers’ collectives Discover the innovative urban street art of Athens, one of the biggest street art scenes in the world Support a fair-trade cooperative and promote sustainability by sipping a tasty coffee provided directly by the producers Tour snapshot On this alternative Athens tour, explore New Athens, a lively hub that was born due to its creativity throughout the financial crisis. Discover the hipster side of Athens with us by exploring its modern street food scene, the hip coffee bars, and the edgy art, interacting with some of the new generation of Athenians who are behind this scene, and capturing the best spots of the city by blowing up your Instagram account! Local impact — How you help the local community by joining this tour: Promote the multicultural and multi-ethnic character of the neighborhoods you visit on this tour By supporting the new generation of Athenians, such as young artists, you promote their work and their enterprises to thrive through the financial crisis

payload.name: The Bohemian Side of Athens Small Group or Private Tours
payload.description: Discover Athens beyond the mainstream attractions, by exploring its bohemian side from funky workshops to cool cafés Duration 4 Hours Highlights Visit Athenians-favourite alternative districts with a local by your side Find amazing graffiti and learn about one of the biggest street art scenes in the world Wander around back streets and discover cultural spaces and art studios Eat and sip your way with a Greek coffee, spirits, sweets, and a meze through the city, as you hear stories and tales behind city sites Tour snapshot Our walking tour of Athens will introduce you to the alternative and artsy sights of Athens, the kind of places that travelers often miss because they don’t know about them. Walk with us and see why it's called the new Berlin. Let us show you a different side of Europe's oldest city, a side that locals only know. Experience alternative Athens by walking downtown Athens’ through back alleys and into neighborhoods where bohemian shops, amazing street art, hidden courtyards, and indie cafés are located, attracting locals and travelers who like escaping the tourist traps. Local impact — How you help the local community by joining this tour: This tour supports the new generation of Athenians, such as young artists, by promoting their work and their enterprises to help them thrive through the financial crisis. By joining this tour we support businesses in neighborhoods that aren’t generally impacted by tourism. Full Itinerary Athens may be famous for its ancient glory like the Parthenon, the Caryatids, and all the other wonders of Greece’s mythical times, but Athens is not only about the past! It is a modern city with creative locals and cool vibes, a city with modern-day stories and secrets to tell, as exciting as the Greek myths! On this Athens city tour, you’ll wander around lesser-known neighborhoods where locals love to hang out and discover secret corners that are beyond areas traditionally found in guidebooks. Your tour will start by sipping a traditional Greek coffee in a central but totally hidden garden known by locals. Enjoy your coffee by sitting among some awesome monuments and hearing stories and tales about the buildings that surround the garden. Continuing your walk, you’ll learn about heroes and outlaws, queens and kings, as well as the centuries-old Athens that is hidden beneath your feet. Strolling through hidden alleys while hearing stories about locals’ traditions and superstitions, you'll pass by bohemian workshops and cultural spaces where new artists have set up their galleries, and see how life is for middle-class Athenians. Then, discover one of the biggest street art scenes in the world. Check out the amazing murals hidden among the bustling streets of the city and learn about the art of graffiti and its importance as a way of expression for the new generation of Athenians. Keep in mind that even the word ‘graffiti’ comes from the Greek word grafi, which means ‘written.’ During this Athens tour, you’ll see the mesmerizing blend of the old with the new, being well-matched (or not) around the city. You will get a better understanding of this Ancient city and how it has evolved nowadays. While walking around with us, you’ll have the opportunity to taste the flavors and aromas of the city, such as sweets, local tapas, and of course spirits. By the end of this tour, you will have experienced the authentic side of Europe's oldest city, Athens! With so many suggestions and tips, you’ll likely have a myriad of things you’ll want to do next! Language: English Inclusions: Greek coffee, a glass of local spirits/wine, a local sweet, a “meze” plate (finger food). Exclusions: Additional food and drink, souvenirs and items of a personal nature, tips, and gratuities.

payload.name: Private Sunset Tour of Cape Sounion, Temple of Poseidon & Athens Riviera
payload.description: Driving along, you will be captivated by the breathtaking Saronic sea on your way to paying tribute to Poseidon, the God of the sea! Enjoy the coastal road past the wonderful beaches of Glyfada, Vouliagmeni, Voula, Varkiza. Witness the crowning jewel…Cape Sounion dominated by the spectacular Temple of Poseidon. Experience the breathtaking sunset while the late afternoon sun bathes the Temple of Poseidon with a golden glorious glow! Enjoy your evening dinner at the Athens Riviera by the Saronic sea!

payload.name: Private Taste of Athens Experience
payload.description: Local Impact: How you will help the local community by joining this tour: All of the stores you visit on your tour are 100% locally owned and run. Supporting small-scale, locally-run businesses helps to preserve the traditional character of old Athens.At least one store on your itinerary is dedicated to the preservation of locally-produced crafts. Thought Greek food was just feta, olives, and a truckload of moussaka? Wrong! This Athens private food tour sets the story straight on the varied food scene in this ancient city with a modern twist, and you’ll leave full of tasty treats and local knowledge on one of the most underrated cuisines in the world. You’ll meet your local guide and begin this Athens tour by exploring Kotzia Square, located in the heart of Athens. The square is surrounded by gorgeous neoclassical buildings, which were constructed in the early 18th century, and also some ancient ruins of old houses that you will have a peek at on your way to the market. Your local guide will show you around the best of the Central Market, taking you to places few tourists venture and helping you to discover a variety of delicious Greek specialties. From the simple koulouri (a round-shaped bread with sesame seeds) and delicate local pastries to the Greek staples of feta and olives, the Central Market is a feast for the senses. We also try either an invigorating Greek coffee (in the winter) or a cold frappe on warmer days, which are popular local beverages. Athens food is a rich mix of old and new, traditional and modern, and this tour is the perfect way to discover all these aspects. Next on your private culinary tour of Athens, we then drop by a Greek deli that sells traditional products and is a popular shopping place for locals. Here you can chat to the shop owner and ask him about all of his produce — and taste some of course! This spot sells the best seasonal food available, perfect for a picnic in the city if you’d like to return another time during your stay in Athens. Finally, on this Athens tour, you’ll make your way to Monastiraki Square where your adventure will end. Your guide will be happy to recommend other places to see in this ancient city and where some of the best local restaurants are located, if you can stomach even more Greek deliciousness! If you feel like slipping into a food coma, your local guide will also give you hand in finding your way back to your accommodation. We reserve the right to change both the route and places visited within the tour. Food inclusions are subject to change, dependent on availability on the day.

payload.name: Greek Cooking Class in Athens Including Rooftop Dinner with Acropolis View
payload.description: Get a taste of authentic Greek cuisine during this 4 -hour cooking class in Athens. Head to a much-loved rooftop patio in the vibrant Monastiraki neighborhood, where you’ll be taught how to prepare and cook classic Greek dishes by an experienced chef. Then, when your work is done, join your fellow food-lovers on the bakery’s roof to enjoy your freshly prepared 3-course dinner with out-of-this-world views of the city and the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Acropolis of Athens. Numbers are limited to an average of 12 participants, ensuring a small-group experience.

payload.name: A Unique Multi Day Tour to Vergina(Ancient Macedonia), Meteora + Ancient Olympia
payload.description: Our trip starts from Athens, so get ready for the most unforgettable tour you'll experience in Greece! This 2 day tour takes you to some of the most popular highlights of Greece. Along the way I'll give you a lot of info about history, mythology and culture. We'll enjoy our visit to Vergina (Ancient Macedonia), and the Royal tombs of Aigai-Vergina. On our way there, we'll have a couple of stops at Thermopylae and Dion. To save up our energy we'll spend the night in a charming town called Kalabaka (NOTE accommodation is not included. The accommodation for all, plus the driver's, must be done by the travelers), where in the evening we'll have free time for activities etc. The second day we'll visit Meteora and Ancient Olympia/the Ancient "Sacred Forrest". To make this trip even more magical we'll go on a little hiking to a breathtaking waterfall, where we'll be able to take a dip in a near by lake. So don't forget to bring your swimsuits! This tour can be adjusted based on your needs.

payload.name: 3 Days Private Tour: Mycenae - Epidaurus - Corinth - Olympia & Delphi
payload.description: Experience the authentic essence of Greece as you journey through its quaint countryside villages, immersing yourself in the rustic charm of rural life. Along the way, discover three of the most revered ancient Greek sanctuaries—Ancient Olympia, Delphi, and Epidaurus—where you'll unravel the mysteries of the past and uncover the spiritual heart of ancient Greece.

payload.name: Epidaurus & Mycenae One Day Tour from Athens
payload.description: Take this Epidaurus & Mycenae One Day Tour from Athens and explore with your guide the ancient city of Mycenae, a major city of the greek civilization and the ancient theatre of Epidaurus.Leave by the coastal road along the Saronic Gulf to the Corinth Canal, which connects the Aegean Sea with the Ionian Sea (short stop).We drive to Mycenae, an Unesco World Heritage Site, the Homeric city of Atreides, the so called city “rich in gold” according to the ancient poets. We visit the Lion’s Gate, the Cyclopean Walls, and the Royal Tombs and the Trasury of Atreus. Lunch in Mycenae.Then we depart for Nauplion (short photo stop) through the fertile plain of Argolis, the picturesque town nestling at the foot of a cliff crowned by the mighty ramparts of the Palamidi Fortress.Last stop wil be Epidaurus, also an Unesco World Heritage site to visit the Theatre (4th century B.C.) famous for its astonishing acoustics.Return to Athens by the National road connecting Epidauros with Corinth.

payload.name: Ancient Corinth Half Day Private Tour from Athens
payload.description: Explore the historic riches of ancient Corinth, once among the most prosperous and celebrated cities in Greece. Venture up to the Acrocorinth, and be captivated by the stunning vistas that unfold before you. As you gaze upon these slopes, let your imagination wander through the myriad of historical narratives that have been crafted upon this hallowed ground.

payload.name: Best rated Acropolis Wine Tasting
payload.description: Taste Greek wines in the most unique way. Right beneath Acropolis. Take a virtual tour through in Greek wine regions. Taste the 5 basic Greek grapes paired with cheese, traditional rusks and olives from all over Greece. This 90-mins wine session will give you the opportunity to learn how to evaluate wines, how to recognize quality wines and get a better perception of the Greek wines and vineyards

payload.name: Athens Gourmet Food Small Group Walking Tour with Tastings
payload.description: Explore the food markets of Athens on a 4-hour walking tour and taste some of the delicious treats on offer. Start with a traditional Greek breakfast of koulóuria (sesame bread rings), and then make your way to a century-old pastry shop to sample loukoumades (Greek donuts) and custard-filled filo squares. Enjoy local pies and cheeses at authentic Greek bakeries. Next, wander through the meat and fish market, the living monument markets of the city. Try dark roasted coffee to one of the older coffee roasters downtown. Enjoy some local wine, organic produce olive oil and honey, seven-year-old aromatized vinegar, and the world-famous Greek yogurt produced at family farms at a small shop that sells fantastic gifts for your friends back home. Wander down Evripidou Street, scented by herbs. Visit a local tavern and explore mezedes plates (local tapas). Then end your culinary exploration by enjoying the famous Greek souvlaki with chicken or pork gyros (Vegetarians are welcomed).

payload.name: 2 Days Private Tour:Persian War-Thermopylae,Marathon,Delphi,Salamis&Plateaus
payload.description: For enthusiasts of ancient Greek warfare, this tour offers a remarkable opportunity to journey to the hallowed grounds of three pivotal battles between the Greeks and the Persians. These historic clashes reshaped the course of Western civilization, and by visiting their battlefields, you'll gain a profound understanding of their significance in shaping our shared history.

payload.name: 5 Days Private Tour: Olympia - Mani - Sparta & Argolida
payload.description: This tour is tailored for those eager to explore Southern Greece thoroughly, immersing themselves in its rich history from the 2nd millennium BCE to the 11th century CE. Starting with a scenic coastal drive, you'll witness charming Greek seaside villages and catch a glimpse of the historic island of Salamis, renowned for the pivotal naval battle between the Athenians and the Persians.

payload.name: Gin tasting experience in Athens
payload.description: We will offer an in depth Gin tasting experience at our specially designed tasting atelier in the historical centre of Athens and discover the top Mediterranean Gins. Sample a range of hand-selected gins as you learn to identify the unique flavours. Our host will introduce and provide guests with a brief history about gin crafting and the traditional ways of making gins. We will taste our way through different gins sampling a variety of different expressions with a small back story behind each one. Our matrix will enhance the overall experience with material around gin crafting. The ultimate experience for gin enthusiasts

payload.name: 4 Days Christmas in Greece Private Tour
payload.description: Experience the magic of Christmas in Greece! Contrary to what some might think, winter in Greece brings chilly weather, snowmen, and elves. Step into a nostalgic journey back to your childhood and immerse yourself in the local festivities.

payload.name: 7 Days Private Tour: Argolida - Sparta - Mani - Olympia - Delphi & Meteora
payload.description: Our goal was to create an extraordinary offering for our guests, an experience that would feed both the soul and the intellect, and be visually stunning at the same time. This led us to design an unforgettable seven-day journey.

payload.name: Corinth & Olive Oil Tasting Private Tour from Athens
payload.description: Embark on a captivating half-day journey that blends the stunning vistas of the Saronic Gulf with the historic allure of Ancient Corinth, one of Greece's key archaeological treasures. This tour offers a deep dive into the origins and production of Greece's most celebrated export, Olive Oil. It's a unique chance to explore the beauty and heritage of the region while uncovering the secrets behind the renowned Greek olive oil.

payload.name: National Archaeological Museum Private Tour with Licensed Expert Guide
payload.description: After meeting your friendly and informative guide at the entrance to the National Archaeological Museum you will start your journey through the fascinating history of Ancient Greece. Recognized as one of the greatest exhibitions worldwide, you'll have access to famous relics of the past such as the Gold 'Death-mask of Agamemnon', the 2000-year old 'Antikithera mechanism', the 'Cup of Nestor', the 'Ring of Theseus', not to mention masterpieces of sculpture like the statues of Aphrodite and Poseidon.  Your private guide will be on hand throughout to provide an appropriate commentary for all ages. Whether your interest is more Mythological, Historical, Focused on one particular aspect, or just to get the main Highlights, our guide will ensure your tour is adapted to your needs. Housed in a beautiful Neoclassic & recently renovated building, the exhibit chambers open out onto a leafy inner garden with mosaics and other artifacts around a relaxing cafe. This is a great way to spend some of your time in Athens and is very family friendly as well as a must-addition to any visit to the Capital.

payload.name: 3 Days PrivateTour: Sparta - Mystra - Monemvasia - Mycenae - Epidaurus & Corinth
payload.description: Embark on a captivating journey through the picturesque landscapes of the Peloponnese peninsula, where history unfolds from prehistoric times to the present day. Explore charming villages, ancient ruins, and storied sites that chronicle the rich tapestry of Greek civilization, offering a unique perspective on the region's timeless allure and enduring legacy.

payload.name: Marathon Battlefield Half Day Private Tour from Athens
payload.description: Athenians valiantly fought the Persians for Greece's liberty, and where the genuine Marathon Race originated. It's an enlightening experience for anyone interested in the pivotal moments of Greek history and the birthplace of one of the world's most iconic athletic events.

payload.name: Marathon & Thermopylae Battlefields Private Day Tour from Athens
payload.description: This tour holds a special place in our hearts, crafted for those who honor the sacrifices made for liberty. Tailored for enthusiasts of ancient military history, it offers an immersive exploration of two pivotal battlefields from the Persian Wars: the plains of Marathon and Thermopylae. It's a tribute to the valor of those who fought for freedom.

payload.name: Epidaurus, Nafplio, Mycenae, Olympia, Delphi and Meteora Five Days Tour
payload.description: Experience the glory of ancient Greece on this Classical Tour including Nauplion – Five Days from Athens. Visit important UNESCO World Heritage sites and overnight stay at Nafplio,the first capital of modern Greece. Led by a professional and passionate guide you will explore the reknowned theater of Epidaurus, Mycenae, home to the kingdom of King Agamemnon, the mythical site of Olympia, the Temple of Apollo in Delphi famous for its oracle and the famous MeteoraItineraryDay 1Leave Athens behind travelling with your luxury air conditioned coach and head west to the strategically important Corinth canal, your first stop for the day.Continue to Epidaurus and visit the Ancient theatre, world famous for its outstanding acoustics.Proceed to the beautiful seaport town of Nafplio. Free afternoon for walking around the old town of Nafplio (the first capital of Greece) or you can visit the Nafplio Gallery of Art with paintings of famous Greek artists dedicated to the Greek revolution.Overnight stay in Nafplion.Day 2Continue the trip to Myceane. Visit the site and the Tomb of Agamemnon. Learn about the classical Greek culture as you walk through this impressive archaeological site.In the afternoon (optional stop for souvenirs and lunch) depart for Olympia. Overnight stay in Olympia.Day 3After breakfast, set off with your guide and visit the archaeological site of Olympia with the Temple of Zeus, the Temple of Hera, the altar of the Olympic flame, the Stadium and the archaeological Museum.Depart via Patras and cross the Corinthian bay by the new bridge. Pass by the city of Nafpaktos and from there on, along the coastal road to Delphi, known in ancient times as the navel of the world.Overnight stay in Delphi.Day 4Rise early and visit the archaeological site of Delphi, one of the important archaeological treasures, also listed as a UNESCO world Heritage site. Head inside the Delphi museum and encounter numerous artifacts and relics that date back to 15th century BC.Continue to Meteora via Central Greece. Overnight stay in Kalabaka.Day 5Leave in the morning for nearby Meteora to visit the breathtaking Byzantine Monasteries. This UNESCO world Heritage site is home for more than 20 rock monasteries. Discover the natural beauty and the cultural heritage of this area.Return to Athens late in the afternoon passing the heroic monument of Leonidas at Thermopylae.

payload.name: Classical Tour of Greece Four Days from Athens
payload.description: Led by a professional and passionate guide, visit Greece's most important UNESCO-heritage sites such as the mythical site of Olympia, the Temple of Apollo in Delphi famous for its oracle and Mycenae, home to the kingdom of King Agamemnon and the breathtaking rocks of Meteora.

payload.name: Sunset Cape Sounio 3 hours Private Tour
payload.description: During this amazing fast tour you will see all the most popular sights down in the coastline of Athens, the best parts of the city. The uniqueness of this tour, combines something different from the other tours. It is cheaper, value for money,and also saves you time. *This tour is very flexible and it goes according to your needs. For any special request you have, please contact our head office to guide you properly about your requests and about everything you need to know...!!*

payload.name: Mycenae Epidaurus Corinth Nafplio Private Day Tour
payload.description: Embark on an unparalleled day tour that offers an immersive blend of antiquity and scenic beauty, presenting the best of Greece's historical treasures alongside the charm of its countryside. Journey through time with visits to the renowned Ancient Corinth, the majestic Acropolis of Mycenae, the enchanting town of Nafplio, and the singular Epidaurus, each site a chapter in a region rich with mythology and historical significance.

payload.name: 4 Days Private Tour: Argolida – Monemvasia & Sparta
payload.description: Embark on a comprehensive 4-day tour of Greece, seamlessly blending visits to various significant sites across the country with an exploration of the Peloponnese peninsula. This immersive journey offers a captivating glimpse into the pivotal moments of Greek history, ensuring a well-rounded introduction to the nation's rich cultural heritage.

payload.name: Full Day Tour to Meteora and Thermopylae Including Dinner
payload.description: Our trip starts from Athens. Great experience, Mercedes cars, comfort and safety transportation under high standards,these are some of the benefits of booking a private transfer with us.Also we can only offer a local guideline on the sites we are going to see, because we are not allowed to guide you inside of them. But, we can provide you with lots of information about the sites we are going to visit. If we can combine it with our passion to show to our travelers our heritage, we think this is the recipe of success. To show to world our amazing and majestic archaeological sites, landscapes etc.

payload.name: One day to Mycenae and Poros Island from Athens
payload.description: Do not miss this rare and unique opportunity to visit in one day the 3.500 years old ruins of the astonishing Mycenaic civilization together with a beautiful and very picturesque Greek Island of the Saronic Golf. Leave by the coastal road along the Saronic Golf to the Corinth Canal (short stop). Drive to Mycenae the Homeric City of Atreides. Visit the Lion's Gate, the Cyclopean walls and the Royal Tombs. Continue driving on for the seaside village of Galatas. From there a small ferry boat will take you in a few minutes at the Island of Poros. Free time for strolling in the beautiful promenade. Lunch by the seaside in a Greek traditional tavern. Early afternoon departure for Athens.

payload.name: CAPE SOUNION: Lake Vouliagmeni, Olive Farm, Poseidon Temple, Thorikos Theatre
payload.description: At the tip of the Attica Peninsula lies Cape Sounion. In easy reach of the city & with an embarrassment of unexplored riches from Ancient sites to idyllic Beaches, its the perfect day trip from Athens. Our tour visits the best of these starting with the natural hot springs lake of Vouliagmeni used for decades as a health resort & where you can stop for a swim. Next visit an organic farm and enjoy a Farm-to-Fork Lunch, and continue besides the Aegean views to the Iconic clifftop Temple of Poseidon & the Ancient Thorikos Theatre, oldest known theater in the world. Our tour is exclusive to your group & uses new luxury Sedan, Minivan or Sprinter models. With your experienced, informative & considerate driver along the way, this is a perfect local excursion to deepen your knowledge of Culture, History & a relaxing getaway all in one. Suitable for families & small groups of all ages.

payload.name: Liquer tasting in Polykala's Distillery Show Room in Athens
payload.description: Join our Liquor tasting in Polykala’s Distillery Show Room in Athens and explore our range of liqueurs in outstanding bottles while you learn about our 122 years story.How it started in 1897? Success came after the World War II? Who kept the distillery?A Greek family distillery that started in Kefallonia Island and moved in Athens. The store is based at the same street where the 2nd and 3rd Generation established the Polykala Distillery.The modern era finds the Polykalas distillery, in Athens. Rena Polykala, fourth generation of distillers, along with her father Giorgos Polykalas, goes on producing alcoholic drinks with a huge enthusiasm and passion, for a customer network that now covers all Greece.The secret recipes of liqueurs of the great grandfather V. Polykalas are used with the same dedication and they are baptized “1897 Polykalas Collection”, they are combined with the modern times, the flavors evolve and take off, the packages are replaced with new luxurious bottles, new products and proposals appear and the name Polykalas has become synonym with quality and good taste.LET’S GET TOGETHER for a liqueur tasting (max 3 flavors 0.02lt each). At the end of our tasting you can choose any 100ml liquor to take home with you (included in the price).

payload.name: 5 Days Private Tour: Meteora - Delphi - Olympia & Argolida
payload.description: This tour is tailor-made for visitors intrigued by Greece's multifaceted allure, encompassing its natural splendor, medieval heritage, ancient roots, and modern history. It offers ample time at each location for a deep dive into Greek culture, ensuring an enriching and immersive experience.

payload.name: 2 Day Private Tour to Thermopylae,Meteora,Ancient Plevrona,Oiniades and Delphi
payload.description: Our trip starts from Athens. On this amazing full day tour you will see the most beautiful sights and scenery. On our way I will give you a lot of information about history, mythology and culture. We will enjoy a visit to Delphi, novel of the world and the religious sites of Meteora. Also, we will pass by Thermopylae, where the 300 Spartans fought and the breathtaking Arachova.We'll spend the night in Delphi (accomodation is not included. The accomodation for all, plus the driver's, must be done by the travellers), where in the evening we'll have free time for activities etc. The second day we will explore the west side of Greece and we will go to Ancient Plevrona and Oiniades, two of the most historical places in Greece. We will combine this trip with the religion, so we are going to visit the great Monastery of Ligovitsi. Our final destination will be Messolonghi town and its castle, before our return in Athens

payload.name: Athens and Cape Sounion Full Day Private Tour Including Meal
payload.description: Visit Athens Highlights, Cape Sounion with a professional driver.During this amazing full day tour you will see the most popular sights and experience the best things that make Athens great. Panoramic tour of Athens, all the way to Cape Sounion, where you can visit the temple of Poseidon. Transportation Mercedes-Benz(sedan, SUV, minivan), that is 3 years old with a full insurance coverage. Clean and Air-conditioned, with Wi-Fi (Free internet). Up to 3-8 customers. What’s Included Guiding Services Private Transportation Other: At the end of our tour, we provide our customers with an All-Inclusive dinner at a local restaurant. The dinner, includes variety of meats and fish dishes based on customer's wish. 4 plates for each one of our customers and a drink of their choice. *Soft drinks, candy and a snack. *Also is included a coffee in a local coffee shop. *liability insurance for each participant ***In the End of our Tour a Great Souvenir Gift is included.!!***

payload.name: 5 Days Private Tour: Delphi – Meteora – Thessaloniki & Pelio
payload.description: This tour is offered to our guests who wish to explore some of the most famous sites but would also like to visit parts of Northern Greece such as Thessaloniki (our second largest city) and regions that have remained untouched by tourism like Pelion. It is a way to see two main sites representing different parts of Greek history.

payload.name: Swim with the Gods Private Tour from Athens
payload.description: Immerse yourself in an extraordinary experience as you swim amidst the divine, alongside the ancient ruins of the revered temple honoring goddess Hera. Delight in a landscape of unparalleled beauty where the remnants of antiquity blend seamlessly with the lush Mediterranean surroundings and the trappings of modern civilization, creating a harmonious tapestry of past, present, and natural splendor.

payload.name: Essential Athens Highlights Plus Cape Sounion Skip-The-Line Tour
payload.description: Private flexible tour combining the Highlights of Athens with a coastal road trip to the Sounion peninsula & amazing clifftop Temple of Poseidon as you relax along the way in one of our new full extra Mercedes models with free WiFi & bottled water in the company of a highly experienced, knowledgeable & considerate Tour driver. Visit the highlights including the Acropolis, Temple of Zeus, Hadrian's Arch, Olympic Stadium, Parliament & changing of the guards, and set off along the deep blue colours of the Aegean sea to explore the Temple of Poseidon. A Skip-the-line Ticket service is included as well as an option to have lunch by the sea in Sounion as well as an expert Archaeological guide for all groups of 8 or more (groups of 1 to 7 by request). With door to door return transfer to your hotel or cruise ship, this comprehensive and 'go at your own pace' tour aims to provide you with one of the most outstanding experiences of your visit.

payload.name: PRIVATE: Athens in a Nutshell-The Best of Athens Tour
payload.description: Discover the best highlights of Athens, such as ancient sights, food, art, and more. On this best-of-Athens tour, see, taste, and explore. If you’re a first-timer in Athens, this tour is the perfect solution for you! In just under 6 hours you will explore the gems of the city, step on the Acropolis Hill, go behind the scenes at the Acropolis Museum, stroll around Plaka, try wrapping a gyro, and of course eat it, visit a famous Greek sandal maker, and admire the Acropolis with a cocktail in hand! Duration 7 Hours Highlights Stroll the historic neighborhoods of Makrygianni, Plaka, Anafiotika, and Philoppapos Hill and marvel at ancient monuments and neo-classical mansions. Visit the Acropolis and the Acropolis Museum with an awarded archaeologist guide Savor freshly baked pastries and homemade sweet bread at a family-owned bakery and a neo-classical gem. Boost your energy with a Freddo espresso or frappé coffee, the famous Greek-style iced coffee. Dig into the country’s largest open-air market for undiscovered “antiques.” Enjoy a cocktail on a rooftop with Acropolis views Taste It, See It, and Experience It — In Athens! Discover the best of Athens in a Day! Tour snapshot Immerse yourself in the Athenian culture by exploring ancient masterpieces and mingling with hipsters in trendy neighborhoods. Explore the best of Athens in a day! Learn all about ancient Greek Mythology while visiting the Acropolis. The city that invented cities has survived for 5,000 years and remains a world-class destination for travelers. Taste it, see it, and experience it with a Local Adventures local guide. Sure, the ancient monuments are exciting but wait until you taste the savory pies hot from the oven and enjoy refreshing cocktails with a view! Behind-the-Scenes Access: Explore the new, modern and impressive Acropolis Museum and walk around the excavations underneath the glass floors. Hands-on Element: Try wrapping your own gyros, at one of the city’s oldest establishments. Local Interactions: Meet local shop owners who have been continuing their family businesses, including a sandal maker who is also a poet and who has had customers such as The Beatles, Barbra Streisand, Lily Tomlin, and Sarah Jessica Parker. Local impact — How you help the local community by joining this tour Your tour supports locally-run businesses, such as a sandal-maker, which helps preserve traditional crafts for the next generation. All of the stores you visit on your tour are 100% locally owned and run. Full Itinerary Begin just off the Acropolis Metro Station in Makrygianni, where you can see 5,000-year-old city remnants nestled beneath the new Acropolis Museum. Follow your licensed guide and walk uphill to admire the Acropolis and listen to myths and tales that formed Greek Mythology. Stroll around Koukaki, one of Athens’s hippest and liveliest neighborhoods. Stop at Taki’s Bakery, which has been satiating neighbors since 1962, for a koulouri sesame ring or tsoureki, a sweet Greek bread. Immerse yourself in the Athenian coffee culture by sipping a Freddo espresso or frappé coffee. In Greece, iced coffee drinks are popular year-round. Next, visit the Acropolis Museum! Explore the new, modern, and impressive Acropolis Museum with your awarded guide. Learn amazing details about all the masterpieces on display and grasp the opportunity to walk among the excavations underneath the glass floors! Then, head to Philopappos Hill. Follow the trail with the marble monument of Philopappos, completed in 119 A.D., and the monument of Pnyx, where ancient Athenians like Pericles and Themistocles spoke. There’s a great view of the Acropolis. More great views await as you stroll Anafiotika, with its cobblestone alleys and the white-washed homes nearly stacked on top of one another. Wander around the historic neighborhood of Plaka and stop for a delicious variety of local pites, or Greek homemade savory pies. Continue to the country’s largest open-air market for treasures, some billed as “antiques” but probably not. Meet a sandal artisan and poet in his workshop. Three generations of his family have served celebrities like Sarah Jessica Parker, The Beatles, and Barbra Streisand. Perhaps order a pair for yourself. Then, try wrapping your own gyros at one of the city’s oldest establishments. It’s not so easy to get the pita filled with meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie, tomato, onion, tzatziki sauce, and, sometimes, French fries. It’s cocktail hour, so we’ll finish up at a hipster bar’s rooftop which has breathtaking views of the Acropolis, the Roman Agora, and Hadrian’s Library. It’s a perfect spot to say “yiamas” to your new friends. Language: English Inclusions: Local, English-speaking licensed guide, one Freddo espresso or frappé coffee, one local Koulouri or Tsoureki, one large portion of Greek pie, one gyro, hands-on Greek experiences, Exclusions: Entrance fees: Please make sure you have cash (euros) as well as hold a valid ID or Passport for verification of age and nationality to purchase the tickets. We buy the tickets for you in advance, in order to avoid lining up. We offer complimentary skip-the-line service: You pay in cash your guide upon meeting him. Adults 25+: 28 euros Citizens from non-EU countries between 6-24: 14 euros European citizens 65+: 14 euros European citizens under 25 years of age are entitled to free entrance to all sites visited during the tour All children 5 years of age and under are entitled to free entrance to all sites visited during the tour Additional food and drinks, souvenirs or personal shopping, tips/gratuities for your guide and driver.

payload.name: Private Tour of National Archaeological Museum of Athens
payload.description: Learn about Greek art and history on a private tour of a must-visit Athens museum: the National Archaeological Museum of Greece. Led by an art-loving licensed tour guide, the tour highlights the most incredible pieces of art created during the different eras of Greek civilization. See key mosaics, statues, the gold selection of Mikynai, the frescos of Santorini prehistoric era and more on this exciting art history tour that includes all public transport costs.

payload.name: Corinth & Swimming with Helen of Troy Private Tour from Athens
payload.description: Explore the captivating blend of natural beauty and historical marvels on this tour, where you'll immerse yourself in the stunning landscapes of the Saronic Gulf and delve into the ancient wonders of Greece at the renowned archaeological site of Ancient Corinth. Don't miss the chance to refresh yourself with a swim at the enchanting "Baths of the beautiful Helen," adding a touch of myth and legend to your unforgettable journey.

payload.name: 10 Days Private Tour: North Greece
payload.description: We've organized a ten-day tour of Northern Greece for those who want to discover the region's highlights without the fuss of figuring out travel routes and deciding which attractions are most worth visiting.

payload.name: PRIVATE: Made In Athens Shopping Tour
payload.description: Discover The Hidden Shops and Artisans of Athens! Duration 4 Hours Highlights Discover hidden shops of Athens that only locals know about. Explore the city’s backstreets, populated by workshops and galleries where artisans handcraft unique pieces of art. Meet a famous Greek sandal-maker who is also a poet. Learn about iconic Greek items (and popular souvenirs), such as evil eyes and worry beads. Dig into authentic Greek flavors with a meze platter and glass of wine at a traditional venue. Discover The Hidden Shops and Artisans of Athens! Tour snapshot Uncover a hidden community of Athens, one that is made up of artists, artisans, and craftspeople. Athens is often described as one of the most “alternative” cities in Europe, so you won’t be short of interesting encounters and sights on this tour! Explore open markets dedicated to antiques and shop for souvenirs that are so much more interesting than fridge magnets – and that, of course, comes with a story of their own. Local impact — How you help the local community by joining this tour Your tour supports the new generation of Athenians, such as young artists, by promoting their work and their enterprises to help them thrive through the financial crisis. This tour also offers you the opportunity to see street art and visit alternative neighborhoods that don’t generally benefit from tourism. All of the stores you visit on your tour are 100% locally owned and run. Supporting small-scale, locally-run businesses helps to preserve the traditional character of old Athens. By joining this tour you are supporting a street vendor who sells traditional koulouri sesame rings, which helps increase his income. At least one store on your itinerary is dedicated to the preservation of locally-produced crafts. Full Itinerary Your Athens shopping tour will start out with a lesson in one of the most authentic traditions of local folklore: the Mati, also known as the evil eye. You will learn about its origins and hear the legends that surround this magical object, which is part of virtually every household in Greece. We’ll also grab a cup of Greek coffee in a very special art gallery so that you’ll have a jolt of caffeine to kick off the rest of your Athens tour! Next up, you’ll learn about worry beads, locally known as komboloi, and a long-standing tradition. We’ll pop into the Komboloi Museum, where you can discover why these fidgety beads are found everywhere in Greece. Next, we’ll head to a shoe workshop that has had customers such as The Beatles, Barbara Streisand, Lily Tomlin, and Sarah Jessica Parker, just to name a few! Find out from the artisan which sandals these celebs eventually bought. Athens holds its own when it comes to contemporary art, so we’ll lead you into one of the most innovative shops, which sells souvenirs crafted by the new generation of Greek artists. You’ll find delightfully fresh and different mementos to take back home, for a very original present for your friends (or yourself!). From art, we’ll move on to another staple of the local culture: ouzo! You’ll visit a store selling endless ouzo varieties, as well as other local products such as olives, olive oil, and honey, all of them from Greek producers. Finally, you’ll learn a bit about a favorite local game. Old cafés in Athens often host men playing tavli, the local version of backgammon. We will tell you everything about this popular game, and you’ll be able to shop for a game to take home with you if you like. Finally, we’ll end our Athens shopping tour at a shop that sells more local tastes (such as more olive oil, of course!), before actually tasting some goods ourselves! We’ll visit a traditional venue and enjoy a platter of meze (seasonal Greek appetizers), paired with a glass of Greek wine. Language: English Inclusions: Food samples (Greek sweets, bread, olive oil, olives, cheeses, rusks, wine, ouzo, traditional meze, and a Greek coffee), train tickets Exclusions: Additional food and drinks, souvenirs or personal shopping, tips/gratuities.

payload.name: Private Helicopter Sightseeing Tour in Athens
payload.shortDescription: Join a private helicopter sightseeing tour in Athens and discover the iconic Greek island from above!
payload.description:
Join a private helicopter sightseeing tour in Athens and discover the iconic Greek city from above!

Athens is the capital city of Greece and one of the oldest cities in the world, with a recorded history spanning over 3,000 years. It is home to many famous historic landmarks and archaeological sites, as well as stunning natural landscapes!

The adventure begins with pick-up from your accommodation in Athens (please specify your location upon booking). The driver will collect you and take you to the helicopter launch pad. The ACH125 Helicopter seats up to 4 passengers, and your group will ride alone in the helicopter with the pilot. After a quick safety and itinerary briefing, you'll fasten your seatbelt and prepare for take-off!

Soaring above this iconic historical city, you'll discover Athens from a unique perspective. Athens is a city where the past and present coexist harmoniously, with ancient ruins, bustling streets, and modern attractions. From the helicopter, you'll have an incredible view of various sites such as the majestic Acropolis, the Temple of Olympian Zeus, and the legendary Panathenaic Stadium. You'll also witness the awe-inspiring Temple of Poseidon at Cape Sounio, standing tall against the sparkling Aegean Sea. Take in the breathtaking views on this smooth and safe flight! At the end of the tour, you'll land back at the starting point and be returned to your accommodation in Athens.

Enjoy a unique helicopter sightseeing tour in Athens and explore the ancient city from the sky!

payload.name: Athens: Pub Crawl + Unlimited Drinks + Nightclub Entry
payload.shortDescription: Enjoy unlimited drinks and party with people from around the world in Athens!
payload.description:
Join an Athenian night out with unlimited drinks for an hour, complimentary shots, and free entry to top nightclubs while meeting people from around the world.

Enjoy a lively pub crawl through Athens' best nightlife spots, where you can drink, dance, and socialize with fellow party-goers.

Follow party guides who will lead the way, ensuring you skip the lines and get into the city's premier clubs.

payload.name: Athens: Guided Beer Tasting Tour
payload.shortDescription: Taste Greek craft beers and sample local artisanal cold cuts
payload.description:
Explore Greece's brewing scene with over 60 local breweries and 300 beer labels. 

Join a guided beer tasting in Patra and learn about the first local microbrewery and its long brewing traditions. 

Try five different Greek craft beers paired with local cheeses, cold cuts, and savory bites. 

Connect with others and learn about Greek beer culture from a knowledgeable guide. 

Enjoy a relaxed evening focused on beer and food, with still water and bread as palate cleansers.

payload.name: Meteora: Day Trip from Athens
payload.shortDescription: Visit six monasteries and a village surrounded by rock formations
payload.description:
Visit Meteora, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Greece, on a day trip from Athens and experience the stunning, monastery-crowned rock formations while learning about their history and geography from a local guide. 

Your day begins with a comfortable departure from Athens, right across from the central train station, traveling in an air-conditioned coach with an English-speaking driver as you enjoy views of the Greek countryside en route to Kalabaka. 

Upon arrival in Meteora around midday, you'll meet your local tour leader and break for lunch in the nearby village of Kastraki, nestled among impressive rock formations. 

After lunch, set out on a guided tour through Meteora’s otherworldly landscape, visiting all six historic monasteries and getting an up-close look at the remarkable rocks as you discover the fascinating stories behind their construction and significance.

payload.name: Museum Of Illusions Athens: Skip The Line Ticket
payload.description:
“Illusion is the first of all pleasures,” said Voltaire, before buying tickets for the Museum Of Illusions in Athens.

Wander a collection of deceptive installations that make your brain gurgle. You'll see things from a different perspective in the Upside Down Room, snap holograms for Instagram, and dazzle your senses. Watch your step in the Vortex Tunnel – it's like stumbling through a kaleidoscope!

payload.name: Athens: Walking Food Tour with Dinner
payload.description:
Experience the vibrant nightlife of Athens by exploring the city and enjoying authentic Greek flavors with a local guide.

Taste the authentic snacks, local delicacies, Greek souvlaki, or a hearty Greek pie.

Walk around and taste specialties like cold cuts, cheeses, olives, and wines. End the evening with dinner at a cozy taverna along with Greek house wine.

payload.name: Best rated wine tasting under the Acropolis
payload.description: You will be greeted warmly by the staff and get settled in. After meeting the local wine connoisseur, you will receive a great overview of the Greek wine region, and with maps and charts take a virtual tour through the wine regions of Greece, taste the 5 basic Greek grapes and understand how different grapes and the diverse terroir of the country have led to the vast number of varieties of wine produced. Paired with artisanal Greek cheeses and delicacies you will discover the incredible flavors that can be created simply by combining different wines. Still water and Greek traditional rusks will be available as palette cleansers. The wine ambassador will be happy to share his love and passion for wine and answer all your questions. A treat for the senses and the mind, you will finish up your tasting feeling more confident in understanding the different wines, thanks to what you‘ve learned and the varieties of wines that you have tasted. This 90-minute session tends to be a very social yet educated wine tasting. You'll join a small group of wine lovers, usually with eight to ten wine-lovers adventurers on board. Definitely, a MUST do experience!

payload.name: Unique vegan food walk in Athens
payload.description: Enjoy the best local vegan and vegetarian food that Athens has to offer on this unique vegan food tour.Join your fantastic hosts, Agatha, Alex and Pigi as they show you around the best local food, one bite at a time. You will be treated to 10+ products, including refreshing complimentary fruit shakes to wash everything down. To accompany all your delicious food, your hosts will also make sure to fill you in on stories about the best of Athenian culture as you make your way around the city.

payload.name: Athenian food tour in Athens
payload.description: Get ready to turn your palate on fire with this gastronomic tour of Athens. You'll be accompanied by a local guide who will show you all the best places and food in the city.You'll start by visiting one of the best spots where to taste local pies. Try out feta cheese pie, spinach pie and much more! You'll then enjoy some local donuts and a traditional coffee.The next stop will be the Central food markets of Athens. Walk among the crowd and let you be amazed by local flavors and products. You'll then taste cheeses and cold cuts from different parts of Greece at a top-rated meze place in Athens.During the second part of the day, you'll discover an alternative Athenian district, where you'll visit one of the oldest bakeries in the city and taste some local snacks. You'll also try different varieties of honey and olive oil.At the end of the day, visit a popular souvlaki place and try the most famous street food in Greece.

payload.name: Around Greece In Five Dishes
payload.description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Embark on a culinary journey to the heart of Greece! Our one-of-a-kind experience features a talented actor who portrays five distinct characters from various regions of Greece, each presenting the speciality dish of their respective area. As you savour each delectable bite, our actor will regale you with fascinating stories about the origins of the dish, the history of the region and the local customs that make it unique. To ensure an authentic and unforgettable experience, all of our dishes are prepared by a renowned Greek chef, using only the freshest and highest quality ingredients. To perfectly complement each dish, we also offer a selection of local wines from the regions. Join us for an afternoon of culinary delight and cultural immersion, as we transport you to the heart of Greece through the power of food and storytelling.

payload.name: Essential Guide to Athenian Street Food
payload.description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Embark on a food tour around Athens with your guide Marina, that quite literally takes it one street at a time. Get to grips with an authentic Athenian street food experience that will make you feel like a local and reevaluate your idea of Greek cuisine. Expect to try Greek dishes like souvlaki and gyros as you walk around the market stalls and street vendors in the center of Athens' ancient city. Visit some of the most beautiful and popular neighborhoods in Athens, and try them, one bite at a time!

payload.name: Learn to Make Pita and Gyros for Dinner in Athens
payload.description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Take part in this hands-on cooking experience and learn everything you need to know to make one of the most iconic Greek dishes, pita and gyros. Your host, Dionysia, will teach you the secrets behind the Greek dish pita-gyros, where you’ll make everything, including the pita bread! Under your host’s helpful guidance, you will also make and enjoy traditional Greek mezze with patsavouropita or bougatsa for dessert! With Dionysia sharing her grandmother’s recipe for tzatziki, you’ll be cooking like a local in no time! You can eat as much as you can! Please come hungry!

payload.name: Athens Evening Food tour
payload.description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Walk through the stunning streets of Athens and enjoy all the Greek delicacies the city has to offer with your local host, Pascal. Explore Athens at a relaxing pace with our local foodie who shares your love for delicious dishes and tasty products. Indulge yourself into a culinary journey during which you’ll get to know the people who create the culinary story of the city. You will taste regional specialties, try the best Greek food and snacks while you discover secret gastronomic gems in some of the most famous food areas of Athens. This food experience offers you a great variety of Greek food and helps you explore the best ingredients and recipes of the Greek cuisine. Please note that the food market is closed during evening hours.

payload.name: Athens Dinner and Food tour
payload.description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

During this food tour you will try some of the most iconic food and drink that make Greek cuisine so special! At the same time, you will learn more about local ingredients and recipes in a fun and informative way. Pascal will take you to local places and hidden gems where you will savor some of the most characteristic Greek food first-hand. After trying specialties such as snacks, pies, dinner, local wine, dessert and much more you won't be leaving hungry!

payload.name: Delicious Dinner and Wine Pairing with Acropolis View
payload.description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Dimitris and Savvas invite you to a 7-course dinner on their stunning rooftop. As you sample the tastiest Greek dishes, you'll have a clear view of Athens' most famous landmark: the Acropolis. Your hosts are passionate cooks and were raised eating and learning about Greek food. Now they want to share their authentic recipes with you and treat you to traditional Greek hospitality in their home in Monatiraki. This experience is a must when in Athens!

payload.name: Delicious Greek Dinner Overlooking the Acropolis
payload.description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Join Dimitris and Savvas on their wonderful rooftop terrace with a breathtaking view of the Acropolis. Whilst you dine on a 7-course seasonal meal, you can admire the view and get to know your local hosts. Your hosts will treat you to traditional Greek hospitality and delicious food made from high quality, locally sourced ingredients.

payload.name: Athens Ultimate Food Tour: Enjoy the best Greek food
payload.description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

This culinary walking experience takes you to the best local places where you will taste some of the most well-known Greek food. You'll visit the central food market and nearby delis and shops (some of them almost a century old).
